page.title: 09TWO CHURCHES, SOMERFORD AREA
page.content: The two Anglican churches in the area look alike.Both of them have towers which look like castle-tops and in their burial grounds they have several table-top graves. Great Somerford Church is dedicated to St.Peter and St.Paul and the font and walls are the oldest parts of the building.It was built from local stone and even the roof is covered with stone tiles.The earliest of the bells was hung in 1480 and in 1975,because they needed retuning and their wooden support frame had become weakened,all 4 bells were taken down,retuned and hung again on a new frame. Little Somerford Church contains a recently uncovered mural showing the Ten Commandments and 2 angels.There is a large marble plaque to the memory of Walter Powell.It has Jacobean box pews and a Victorian font.
